name: Sorathan Chaturapruek
title: Search Data Software Engineer at Yelp / CS PhD Student at Stanford
summary: I'm a second-year computer science PhD student at Stanford University. I'm interested in statistical machine learning, information theory, and data mining. Previously, I was a math and CS double major at Harvey Mudd College, a crime modeling researcher at UCLA, a search software engineer at Yelp, a researcher in math at Harvey Mudd College and Budapest University of Technology and Economics. I'm an enthusiast in learning Chinese and piano, and a regular participant in hackathons and education events.My personal website: http://cs.stanford.edu/~sorathanFor my CV (may not up-to-date), please visit https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/67300625/Profile/tum_chaturapruek_cv_shortened.pdf

companies.title: Search Data Team Software Engineering Intern
companies.description: Bizmatch service v2. Bizmatch is an algorithm to match partial business information (e.g., name, address, GPS location, suggested business id) with businesses in the Yelp databases. This service is used in many applications at Yelp, but notably in data ingestion, where we ingest business data and updates from third-party partners. I used a data-driven approach to improve the business match algorithm, starting by monitoring and quantifying performance of each partner. I set up a whole harness for testing Yelp's bizmatch (which I developed last summer) against gold data sets and then crowd-sourced the gold datasets.I fixed many false negatives, false positives, mismatches, and also improved bizmatch speed, precision, and recall across many partners. Collaborating with colleagues at Yelp, I also developed front-end tools (mostly with AngularJs) to allow humans to quickly see matching business candidates during labeling and to debug bizmatch in general.

companies.title: Student Researcher
companies.description: Worked with Professor Mohamed Omar on computational geometry and robotics problems. Investigated the shortest path problem among 3D obstacles of specific types. Preprint is ready to submit (more details to come).title: Robots can quickly avoid pillars

companies.title: Student Researcher, Senior Thesis in Mathematics
companies.description: (Working with Professor Weiqing Gu)- Researching Unmanned Aerial Vehicles using Lie groups, Lie algebra, and machine learning techniques such as reinforcement learning. Investigated quadrotor landing and control problems.(http://www.math.hmc.edu/~schaturapruek/thesis/).

companies.title: Student Researcher and Developer, Clinic Program in Computer Science
companies.company: Computer Science Department, Harvey Mudd College
companies.description: (Worked with Thomas Ashmore, Corinne Druhan, Bridgette Eichelberger, Professor Micheal Erlinger and Elizabeth Schofield)− Developing and improving the existing Middle-years Computer Science (MyCS) curriculum for mid- dle and high school teachers to emphasize development of a computational identity, described as a student’s self-definition regarding his or her computational thinking skills.− Deploying a web instance on Amazon EC2 and a local server for MyCS Massive Open Online Course;

companies.title: Mathematics Academic Facilitator
companies.description: − As an Academic Excellence (AE) Math Tutor, I am part of a team responsible for leading homework help sessions,workshops and exam reviews that reinforce the material covered in the math core plus Math 55 (Discrete Mathematics), 70 (Linear Algebra), and 80 (Differential Equations). The job requires creativity, leadership, and a sense of humor, as well as the ability to help first- and second-year students master fundamental math concepts.− Held tutoring sessions for students taking courses in linear algebra, differential equations, probability & statistics, and discrete mathematics. Presented tutoring strategies in staff development meetings;

companies.title: Search Team Software Engineering Intern
companies.description: Software Engineering in the search team(Worked with Mentor Scott Triglia, Search Data and Search Infrastructure Teams)− Designed and implemented an end-to-end workflow for business match service, which matches partial business information to businesses in the Yelp database. This service is used for various purposes such as deduplication and updating business information from the third party companies.− Wrote scripts to parse results from Elastic Search and used AngularJS to write an admin page for debugging searching results. Incorporated TF-IDF weighting into scoring schema− Evaluated matching results using domain-specific evaluation metrics for different use cases and presented the result to the rest of the search team.− Received an offer for a full-time position in the Search team.

companies.title: Grader, Verification-Centric Software Engineering
companies.company: Computer Science Department, Harvey Mudd College
companies.description: (Worked with Professor Daniel Zimmerman)− Graded homework assignments and projects. Topics include tools, techniques, and theory for the specification, implementation, verification and testing of object-oriented software systems. Students use BON (the Business Object Notation), Java, JML (the Java Modeling Language), and various software tools to build, verify, and test non-trivial systems− Wrote scripts to test submitted homework and to automate score computation & distribution.

companies.title: Student Researcher, Spectral Clustering of Networks
companies.company: Budapest Semesters in Mathematics, Budapest University of Technology and Economics
companies.description: (Worked with Professor Marianna Bolla, Brian Bullins, Shiwen Chen, and Professor Katalin Friedl)− Modeled networks by edge-weighted graphs, where edge-weights are pairwise similarities between the sites (vertices of the graph). Investigated clusters (communities) of the vertices such that the information flow between the cluster pairs and within the clusters is as homogeneous as possible.− Used the smallest eigenvalues of the Laplacian or normalized Laplacian matrix assigned to the graph to estimate minimum multiway cuts, whereas clusters are found by the corresponding eigenvectors.− Discovered a new condition in which the modularity matrices are negative semidefinite, which implies that the clusters are indivisible.(http://arxiv.org/abs/1305.2147);

companies.title: Software Developer, Educational Geometric Game Software Development
companies.description: (Worked with the TriangleLand Team and Luke Mastalli-Kelly, sponsored by HMC via a grant from the Colegato Foundation)− Developed a geometric educational game in Java to help high school students transition to proof-based mathematics in college;

companies.title: Math Researcher, Harmonic Analysis on Finite Groups and Machine Learning on Groups
companies.description: (Worked with Jeremy Usatine (HMC’14), Professors Michael Orrison and Susan Martonosi)− Modeled predictions of who is in an adjacent room given limited observations of who is entering or leaving the room. We investigated how we could quickly calculate probabilities according to our model− Used an isotypic decomposition of C[X] such that the isotypic subspaces correspond to irreducible representations of the Fourier transform on Sn, which are indexed by partitions of n, to show that some of this methodology can be extended to the case where X is k sized subsets of {1,2,...,n}.(https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/67300625/tum_fall_2012_representation.pdf);

companies.title: Math Researcher, Crime Modeling with Levy Flights
companies.description: (Worked with Jonah Breslau (Pomona), Daniel Yazdi (UCLA), Professor Theodore Kolokolnikov (Dalhousie University) and Scott G. McCalla (UCLA))− Modeled the formation of hotspots of criminal activity by extending the existing model to incorporate a more realistic model of human locomotion called Lévy flights. Studied how Lévy flights affect the stability of hot-spots in a crime model.− Performed linear stability analysis and wrote MATLAB code to numerically verify theoretical results.− S. Chaturapruek, J. Breslau, D. Yazdi, T. Kolokolnikov, and S.G. McCalla, Crime Modeling with Levy Flights, SIAM Journal on Applied Mathematics 73, 1703-1720 (2013). DOI: 10.1137/120895408 (http://dx.doi.org/10.1137/120895408). Also featured in a SIAM Nugget (http://connect.siam.org/tracking-criminal-movement-using-math/);

companies.title: Student Researcher, Algebraic Statistics
companies.description: (Worked with Jacob Brumbaugh-Smith (Pomona) and Professor Michael Orrison)− Studied the Markov basis for some graphs such as the Johnson graph.− Used a software package called 4ti2 to find conjectures about nested summary statistics, and then mathematically proved those conjectures.(https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/67300625/tum_summer_2012_giovanni.pdf).

companies.title: Grader and Tutor, Abstract Algebra
companies.description: − Graded and tutored students taking Abstract Algebra class. Topics include groups, rings, fields, vector spaces, and modules; polynomial and field extensions; applications to number theory.

companies.title: Student Researcher, Geometry through Lie Groups and Discrete Subgroups
companies.company: Research Experiences for Undergraduates (REU), University of Utah College of Science
companies.description: − Investigated the growth rates of nilpotent linear groups and solvable linear groups using Cayley graph and the words metric.− Studied Thurston Theorem, p-adic numbers, buildings and Coxeter groups.

companies.title: Participant, ISMO Thailand Representative Selection Project for International Math Olympiad
companies.company: the International Science and Mathe Olympiad Thailand Representative Selection Project for Thailand
companies.description: − Selected in the Final Round Selective Training Camps for 3 years. Those top 6 finalists will represent Thailand for International Mathematics Olympiad (IMO). I was a top 15 finalist each year.− Studied Olympiad-level geometry, inequalities, combinatorics, number theory, functional equations, and algebra.

companies.title: Student Researcher, Geometric Transformations
companies.company: Chulalongkorn University (through the JSTP program) and Mahidol Wittayanusorn School
companies.description: (Worked with Professor Nataphan Kitisin (Chulalongkorn University))− Studied the structure of a sequence of geometric transformations of bicentric quadrilaterals, also using a computer software (The Geometer’s Sketchpad) as a researching tool.− Won a special prize in the International Scientific Conference of Students, XVIII Annual Sakharov’s Readings, Saint Petersburg, Russia.(https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/67300625/tum_bicentric.pdf)

companies.title: Student Researcher, Design Theory
companies.company: Srinakharinwirot Patumwan University and Mahidol Wittayanusorn School, Thailand
companies.description: (Worked with Professor Dinesh G. Sarvate (College of Charleston, SC))− Studied design theory (a branch of combinatorial mathematics and computer science) and the decomposition of complete bipartite graphs− Decomposed the complete bipartite graphs into specific types of subspaces, such as the set of paths of a fixed length and the set of star with equal degree.
